bill_title: extend residency status to certain students for purposes of higher education tuition.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend residency status to certain students for purposes of higher education tuition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-53 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Board of Regents shall classify a person as a resident for purposes of tuition if the person achieved a score on the enhanced ACT assessment by American College Testing, Incorporated, of twenty-six (26) or higher, or one thousand one hundred eighty (1,180), or higher, on the scholastic aptitude test (SAT-I) by Educational Testing Service. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend residency status to certain students for purposes of higher education tuition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-53 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Board of Regents shall classify a person as a resident for purposes of undergraduate tuition if the person achieved a score on the enhanced ACT assessment by American College Testing, Incorporated, of twenty-seven (27) or higher, or one thousand one hundred eighty (1,180), or higher, on the scholastic aptitude test (SAT-I) by Educational Testing Service. This section does not apply to any person enrolled at an institution of higher education under the control of the board on July 1, 2000. BILL HISTORY 1/15/00 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 53 1/24/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/24/00 State Affairs Deferred to another day. 1/26/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/31/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/2/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/7/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/7/00 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 4. H.J. 476

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to extend residency status to certain students for purposes of higher education tuition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-53 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Board of Regents may classify a person as a resident for purposes of undergraduate tuition if the person achieved a score on the enhanced ACT assessment by American College Testing, Incorporated, of twenty-seven (27) or higher, or one thousand one hundred eighty (1,180), or higher, on the scholastic aptitude test (SAT-I) by Educational Testing Service. This section does not apply to any person enrolled at an institution of higher education under the control of the board on July 1, 2000. BILL HISTORY 1/15/00 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 53 1/24/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/24/00 State Affairs Deferred to another day. 1/26/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/31/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/2/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/7/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/7/00 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 4. H.J. 476
